CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Material Name
------------

* polystyrene
* PQCDTB
* PCZDTB

Explanation:

* "polystyrene" is a material that is commonly used as a standard in GPC measurements.
* "PQCDTB" and "PCZDTB" are materials for which the number-average molecular weights (Mn) were measured using polystyrene as the standard.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

| Mn (number - average molecular weights) |

The valid "Property Name" entities that clearly refer to material properties in the paragraph are: GPC and Mn (number - average molecular weights). The term "kg / mol" is a unit of measurement and not a material property, so it has been removed from the table.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

| 15.2 kg / mol |

Explanation:

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are the number-average molecular weights (Mn) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB, which are given as 49.8 kg / mol and 15.2 kg / mol, respectively. These values are presented in a table, and they are measured using polystyrene as the standard.

Therefore, these are the only entities presented in the table. The phrase "using polystyrene as the standard" is not a value of a material property and is not included in the table.
